page.title: 16GREAT BENTLEY REMEMBERED
page.content: GEORGE KEEBLE WAS BORN IN AINGERS GREEN IN 1902. AT FOUR AND A HALF YEARS OF AGE I WALKED THREE MILES TO THE SCHOOL IN GT BENTLEY. YOU HAD TO BEHAVE YOURSELVES OR YOU GOT A CANING, WITH NO QUESTIONS ASKED. WE ATE OUR SANDWICHES IN THE SCHOOL SHED AND THEN AMUSED OURSELVES ON THE GREEN MUCH OF WHICH WAS COVERED WITH GORSE. MANY GAMES TOOK PLACE SUCH AS PAPER CHASES. I LEFT SCHOOL IN 1915. AT THIS TIME THERE WERE MANY SMALL SHOPS AND THREE BAKERIES. I WAS A TELEGRAPH BOY DURING THE 1914-18 WAR, WHEN THERE WERE 1000 TROOPS STATION IN THE VILLAGE. IN 1921 A VILLAGE BAND WAS FORMED, OF WHICH I WAS SECRETARY. BEFORE 1914 THERE WERE NO CARS IN THE VILLAGE, ALL TRANSPORT BEING HORSE-DRAWN.
